00078 class core_exec_t
00079 {
00080   public:
00081 
00082   /* watchdog for detecting dead/live-locked simulations */
00083   tick_t last_completed;
00084   counter_t last_completed_count;
00085 
00086   core_exec_t(void);
00087   virtual ~core_exec_t();
00088   virtual void reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t *const sdb) = 0;
00089   virtual void freeze_stats(void) = 0;
00090   virtual void update_occupancy(void) = 0;
00091   void update_last_completed(tick_t now);
00092 
00093   /* "step()" functions */
00094   virtual void ALU_exec(void) = 0;
00095   virtual void LDST_exec(void) = 0;
00096   virtual void RS_schedule(void) = 0;
00097   virtual void LDQ_schedule(void) = 0;
00098 
00099   virtual void recover(const struct Mop_t * const Mop) = 0;
00100   virtual void recover(void) = 0;
00101 
00102   /* adds uop to a ready queue; called by alloc and exec */
00103   virtual void insert_ready_uop(struct uop_t * const uop) = 0;
00104 
00105   /* RS management functions
00106      RS_available() returns true if an RS entry is available
00107      RS_insert() inserts a uop into the RS
00108      RS_fuse_insert() adds a fused uop body to the uop head
00109        (and any previously fuse_inserted uops) to an already
00110        allocated RS entry (i.e., that alloc'd to the head)
00111      RS_deallocate() removes a uop from the RS; in the case
00112        of fused uops, should be called when the last uop exec's */
00113   virtual bool RS_available(void) = 0;
00114   virtual void RS_insert(struct uop_t * const uop) = 0;
00115   virtual void RS_fuse_insert(struct uop_t * const uop) = 0;
00116   virtual void RS_deallocate(struct uop_t * const uop) = 0;
00117 
00118   /* LDQ management functions
00119      LDQ_availble() returns true if a LDQ entry is available
00120      LDQ_insert() inserts a load uop into the LDQ
00121      LDQ_deallocate() removes a uop from the LDQ (called at commit)
00122      LDQ_squash() squashes and deallocates the LDQ entry */
00123   virtual bool LDQ_available(void) = 0;
00124   virtual void LDQ_insert(struct uop_t * const uop) = 0;
00125   virtual void LDQ_deallocate(struct uop_t * const uop) = 0;
00126   virtual void LDQ_squash(struct uop_t * const dead_uop) = 0;
00127 
00128   /* STQ management functions
00129      STQ_availble() returns true if a STQ entry is available
00130      STQ_insert_sta() allocates a STQ entry to the STA uop
00131      STQ_insert_std() adds the STD uop to the same STQ entry
00132      STQ_deallocate_sta() removes the STA uop from the STQ
00133      STQ_deallocate_std() removes the STD uop from the STQ
00134      STQ_deallocate_senior() removes the store-writeback from the STQ
00135      STQ_squash_sta() squashes the STA uop from the STQ entry and
00136         deallocates the STQ entry
00137      STQ_squash_std() squashes and removes the STD uop from the STQ
00138      STQ_squash_senior() squashes and removes the store-writeback
00139         from the senior STQ
00140    */
00141   virtual bool STQ_available(void) = 0;
00142   virtual void STQ_insert_sta(struct uop_t * const uop) = 0;
00143   virtual void STQ_insert_std(struct uop_t * const uop) = 0;
00144   virtual void STQ_deallocate_sta(void) = 0;
00145   virtual bool STQ_deallocate_std(struct uop_t * const uop) = 0;
00146   virtual void STQ_deallocate_senior(void) = 0;
00147   virtual void STQ_squash_sta(struct uop_t * const dead_uop) = 0;
00148   virtual void STQ_squash_std(struct uop_t * const dead_uop) = 0;
00149   virtual void STQ_squash_senior(void) = 0;
00150 
00151   /* Just a sanity-check after a recovery that the exec-stage's
00152      microarchitectural state is consistent. */
00153   virtual void recover_check_assertions(void) = 0;
00154 
00155   protected:
00156   struct core_t * core;
00157 
00158 };
00159 
00160 void exec_reg_options(struct opt_odb_t * odb, struct core_knobs_t * knobs);
00161 class core_exec_t * exec_create(const char * exec_opt_string, struct core_t * core);
00162 
00163 #endif /* ZESTO_EXEC_INCLUDED */
